prompt: what is the S-3 API to upload a file to AWS?
orig_response: The S3 API is a RESTful (Representational State of Resource) API provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) to interact with Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service), a cloud-based object storage service. To upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API, you can use the PUT Object operation. This operation allows you to upload a file to a specified bucket and key (file path). The request typically includes the file contents, bucket name, key, and optional metadata such as file size, last modified date, and content type. The API endpoint for uploading a file to S3 is `https://<bucket-name>.s3.amazonaws.com/<key>`, where `<bucket-name>` is the name of the S3 bucket and `<key>` is the file path. The request body contains the file contents, and the request headers include the `Content-Length` header to specify the file size and the `Content-Type` header to specify the file type.

revised_fact_jsonified_all.revised_unit: The S3 API is a RESTful API.
The S3 API provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a Representational State of Resource API.
The S3 API is provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Amazon Web Services is abbreviated as AWS.
The S3 API is used to interact with Amazon Simple Storage Service.
Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is a cloud-based object storage service.
Amazon S3 is abbreviated as Simple Storage Service.
Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is a service that allows file uploads.
The S3 API can be used to upload a file to Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service).
The S3 API provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS) to interact with Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) has a PUT Object operation.
The PUT Object operation using the S3 API can be used to upload a file to Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service).
The PUT Object operation allows you to upload a file.
The PUT Object operation allows you to upload a file to an S3 bucket.
The PUT Object operation allows you to upload a file to a specified S3 bucket.
The PUT Object operation allows you to upload a file to a specified key (file path).
The PUT Object operation allows you to upload a file to a specified key.
The key in the S3 API endpoint is the file path.
The request to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API includes the file contents.
The request for the PUT Object operation to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API includes the name of the S3 bucket.
The request to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API includes the file path.
The request to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API may include metadata.
File size is a type of metadata.
Last modified date is a type of metadata.
Content-Type header is a type of metadata.
The API endpoint for uploading a file to S3 is used for uploading a file to S3.
The S3 API endpoint for uploading a file to Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) is https://<bucket-name>.s3.amazonaws.com/<key>.
The name of the S3 bucket represents the name of the S3 bucket.
The key (file path) represents the file path.
The request body of the PUT Object operation in the S3 API contains the file contents being uploaded.
The request headers of the request to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API include the `Content-Length` header.
The `Content-Length` header in the request headers for uploading a file to S3 using the S3 API specifies the file size.
The request headers of the request to upload a file to AWS S3 using the S3 API include the `Content-Type` header.
The `Content-Type` header of the PUT Object operation of the S3 API specifies the file type.
